data.quote: We are less likely to fail if we measure with judgement our chances and our capabilities.
data.author: Agnes Repplier

data.quote: Laziness is a secret ingredient that goes into failure. But it's only kept a secret from the person who fails.
data.author: Robert Half

data.quote: Failure is usually the line of least persistence.
data.author: Wilfred Beaver

data.quote: You can't expect to win unless you know why you lose.
data.author: Benjamin Lipson

data.quote: Most people don't plan to fail  they fail to plan.
data.author: John L. Beckley

data.quote: Failure is not sweet  but it need not be bitter.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The ultimate umpire of all things in life is - fact.
data.author: Agnes C. Laut

data.quote: Losses are comparative  imagination only makes them of any moment.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: I would prefer even to fail with honor than win by cheating.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Disillusion is a natural stage that follows the holding of an illusion.
data.author: Susan Shaughnessy

data.quote: If any good results to a man from believing a lie  it certainly comes from the honesty of his belief.
data.author: Margaret Collier Graham

data.quote: And what if I did run my ship aground  oh  still it was splendid to sail it!
data.author: Henrik Ibsen

data.quote: Success is a public affair. Failure is a private funeral.
data.author: Rosalind Russell

data.quote: It is not easy  but you have to be willing to make mistakes. And the earlier you make those mistakes  the better.
data.author: Jane Cahill Pfeiffer

data.quote: If you're gonna be a failure  at least be one at something you enjoy.
data.author: Sylvester Stallone

data.quote: Who would not rather flounder in the fight than not have known the glory of the fray?
data.author: Richard Hovey

data.quote: Better a false belief than no belief at all.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: A mistake is simply another way of doing things.
data.author: Katherine Graham

data.quote: The probability that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter us from the support of a cause we believe to be just.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Three failures denotes uncommon strength. A weakling had not enough grit to fail thrice.
data.author: Minna Antrim

data.quote: Thou shouldst not decide until thou hast heard what both have to say.
data.author: Aristophanes

data.quote: All is fair in love and war.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: What is sauce for the goose is sauce for the gander.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Nothing can be truer than fairy wisdom. It is as true as sunbeams.
data.author: Douglas Jerrold

data.quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time  the laugh broke into a million pieces  and they all went skipping about. That was the beginning of fairies.
data.author: Sir James Matthew Barrie

data.quote: Fairies  black  grey  green  and white  You moonshine revellers  and shades of night.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Spirit is the real and eternal  matter is the unreal and the temporal.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: Faith sees the invisible  believes the unbelievable  and receives the impossible.
data.author: Corrie ten Boom

data.quote: For the facts that make up the world need the non-factual as a vantage point from which to be perceived.
data.author: Ingeborg Bachmann

data.quote: Faith is nothing at all tangible. ... It is simply believing God  and like sight  it is nothing apart from its object. You might as well shut your eyes and look inside  and see whether you have sight  as to look inside to discover whether you have faith.
data.author: Hannah Whitall Smith

data.quote: Faith is the daring of the soul to go farther than it can see.
data.author: William Newton Clark

data.quote: Spirituality leaps where science cannot yet follow  because science must always test and measure  and much of reality and human experience is immeasurable.
data.author: Starhawk

data.quote: All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen.
data.author: Ralph Hodgson

data.quote: Faith is like radar that sees through the fog-the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.
data.author: Corrie ten Boom

data.quote: Faith sees the invisible  believes the incredible and receives the impossible.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: A believer  a mind whose faith is consciousness  is never disturbed because other persons do not yet see the fact which he sees.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: We walk by faith  not by sight.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Faith is to believe what we do not see  the reward of this faith is to see what we believe.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Because you cannot see him  God is everywhere.
data.author: Yasunari Kawabata

data.quote: Sorrow looks back  worry looks around  faith looks up.
data.author: Guideposts

data.quote: You have to believe in gods to see them.
data.author: Hopi Indian saying

data.quote: Faith declares what the senses do not see  but not the contrary of what they see.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: Faith has to do with things that are not seen  and hope with things that are not in hand.
data.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

data.quote: Faith is the capacity of the soul to perceive the abiding ... the invisible in the visible.
data.author: Leo Baeck

data.quote: Deep faith eliminates fear.
data.author: Lech Walesa

data.quote: A red-hot belief in eternal glory is probably the best antidote to human panic that there is.
data.author: Phyllis Bottome

data.quote: Our faith triumphant o'er our fears.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Let nothing disturb you  nothing frighten you  all things are passing  God never changes.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: Fear imprisons  faith liberates  fear paralyzes  faith empowers  fear disheartens  faith encourages  fear sickens  faith heals  fear makes useless  faith makes serviceable.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: Fear knocked at the door. Faith answered. And lo  no one was there.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I knew without a glimmer of doubt that all things in the universe were connected by a living truth that would not relent its continuing search for wholeness until every form of life was united.
data.author: Lynn V. Andrews

data.quote: Unity  not uniformity  must be our aim. We attain unity only through variety. Differences must be integrated  not annihilated  not absorbed.
data.author: Mary Parker Follett

data.quote: By virtue of love is the lover transformed in the beloved and the beloved transformed in the lover.
data.author: Saint Angela of Foligno

data.quote: Spiritual love is a position of standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world  letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy.
data.author: Christina Baldwin

data.quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others  by means of love  friendship  indignation and compassion.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: Patience with others is Love  Patience with self is Hope  Patience with God is Faith.
data.author: Adel Bestavros

data.quote: God is universal  confined to no spot  defined by no dogma  appropriated by no sect.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: Trying to do good to people without God's help is no easier than making the sun shine at midnight. You discover that you've got to abandon all your own preferences  your own bright ideas  and guide souls along the road our Lord has marked out for them. You mustn't coerce them into some path of your own choosing.
data.author: Therese of Lisieux

data.quote: All our acts have sacramental possibilities.
data.author: Freya Stark

data.quote: We must have infinite faith in each other.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: As contagion of sickness makes sickness  contagion of trust can make trust.
data.author: Marianne Moore

data.quote: Faith in our associates is part of our faith in God.
data.author: Charles Horton Cooley

data.quote: Those who trust us educate us.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: He who has no faith in others shall find no faith in them.
data.author: Lao-Tzu

data.quote: Don't lose faith in humanity: think of all the people in the United States who have never played you a single nasty trick.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: You can't leave humanity out. If you didn't have humanity  you wouldn't have anything.
data.author: Alice Neel

data.quote: I plunged into the job of creating something from nothing. ... Though I hadn't a penny left  I considered cash money as the smallest part of my resources. I had faith in a living God  faith in myself  and a desire to serve.
data.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

data.quote: Faith in oneself... is the best and safest course.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others.
data.author: Erich Fromm

data.quote: I never really look for anything. What God throws my way comes. I wake up in the morning and whichever way God turns my feet  I go.
data.author: Pearl Bailey

data.quote: In order to experience everyday spirituality  we need to remember that we are spiritual beings spending some time in a human body.
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: We must move from asking God to take care of the things that are breaking our hearts  to praying about the things that are breaking His heart.
data.author: Margaret Gibb

data.quote: Peace ... was contingent upon a certain disposition of the soul  a disposition to receive the gift that only detachment from self made possible.
data.author: Elizabeth Goudge

data.quote: You must never lose the awareness that in yourself you are nothing  you are only an instrument. An instrument is nothing until it is lifted.
data.author: Katheryn Hulme

data.quote: It's very reassuring and spiritual to be connected with something larger than yourself and the inside of your own head.
data.author: Joan Osborne

data.quote: With all this wide and beautiful creation before me  the restless soul longs to enjoy its liberty and rest beyond its bound.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: The country in which I live is not my native country  that lies elsewhere  and it must always be the center of my longings.
data.author: Therese of Lisieux

data.quote: The great majority of men use their own short-sighted ideas as a yardstick for measuring the divine omnipotence.
data.author: Therese of Lisieux

data.quote: Faith is the centerpiece of a connected life. It allows us to live by the grace of invisible strands. It is a belief in a wisdom superior to our own. Faith becomes a teacher in the absence of fact.
data.author: Terry Tempest Williams

data.quote: Faith doesn't wait until it understands  in that case it wouldn't be faith.
data.author: Vance Havner

data.quote: Your faith is what you believe  not what you know.
data.author: John Lancaster Spalding

data.quote: That's the thing about faith. If you don't have it you can't understand it. And if you do  no explanation is necessary.
data.author: Major Kira Nerys

data.quote: Our body is not made of iron. Our strength is not that of stone. Live and hope in the Lord  and let your service be according to reason.
data.author: Saint Clare of Assisi

data.quote: No  I don't understand my husband's theory of relativity  but I know my husband  and I know he can be trusted.
data.author: Elsa Einstein

data.quote: It is faith  and not reason  which impels men to action. ... Intelligence is content to point out the road  but never drives us along it.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: Faith consists  not in ignorance  but in knowledge  and that  not only of God  but also of the divine will.
data.author: John Calvin

data.quote: Faith is an excitement and an enthusiasm  a state of intellectual magnificence which we must not squander on our way through life.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: All the scholastic scaffolding falls  as a ruined edifice  before a single word: faith.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: Some like to understand what they believe in. Others like to believe in what they understand.
data.author: Jerzy Lee Stanislaw

data.quote: Seek not to understand that thou mayest believe  but believe that thou mayest understand.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Faith is a sounder guide than reason. Reason can go only so far  but faith has no limits.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: Logic is the key to an all-inclusive spiritual well-being.
data.author: Marlene Dietrich

data.quote: It is the heart which experiences God  and not the reason.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: There is no object that we see  no action that we do  no good that we enjoy  no evil that we feel  or fear  but we may make some spiritual advantage of all: and he that makes such improvement is wise  as well as pious.
data.author: Anne Bradstreet

data.quote: Faith is the continuation of reason.
data.author: William Adams

data.quote: If we were logical  the future would be bleak indeed. But we are more than logical. We are human beings  and we have faith  and we have hope.
data.author: Jacques Cousteau

data.quote: Faith is the art of holding on to things your reason has once accepted  in spite of your changing moods.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Reason is the triumph of the intellect  faith of the heart.
data.author: James Schouler

data.quote: Reason is our soul's left hand  Faith her right. By this we reach divinity.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: It is as absurd to argue men  as to torture them  into believing.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: Reason's voice and God's  Nature's and Duty's  never are at odds.
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: The way to see by Faith is to shut the eye of Reason.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Faith is believing what we cannot prove.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Faith is to believe what you do not yet see  the reward for this faith is to see what you believe.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Faith is believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Faith is a higher faculty than reason.
data.author: Henry Christopher Bailey

data.quote: Faith is reason grown courageous.
data.author: Sherwood Eddy

data.quote: Faith is the result of the act of the will  following upon a conviction that to believe is a duty.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: So often we have a kind of vague  wistful longing that the promises of Jesus should be true. The only way really to enter into them is to believe them with the clutching intensity of a drowning man.
data.author: William Barclay

data.quote: Man makes holy what he believes  as he makes beautiful what he loves.
data.author: Ernest Renan

data.quote: If life is a comedy to him who thinks  and a tragedy to him who feels  it is a victory to him who believes.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: You're not free until you've been made captive by supreme belief.
data.author: Marianne Moore

data.quote: It is by believing in roses that one brings them to bloom.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: If you wish to strive for peace of soul and pleasure  then believe.
data.author: Heinrich Heine

data.quote: Loving is half of believing.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: A faith that sets bounds to itself  that will believe so much and no more  that will trust so far and no further  is none.
data.author: Julius Charles Hare

data.quote: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: Doubt is a necessity of the mind  faith of the heart.
data.author: Comtesse Diane

data.quote: For the truly faithful  no miracle is necessary. For those who doubt  no miracle is sufficient.
data.author: Nancy Gibbs

data.quote: My faith has wavered but has saved me.
data.author: Helen Hayes

data.quote: Faith which does not doubt is dead faith.
data.author: Miguel de Unamuno

data.quote: To believe with certainty  we must begin with doubting.
data.author: Stanislaus I

data.quote: O thou of little faith  why didst thou doubt?
data.author: Bible

data.quote: In the midst of your doubts  don't forget how many of the important questions God does answer.
data.author: Verne Becker

data.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. Let us move forward with strong and active faith.
data.author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

data.quote: It is impossible on reasonable grounds to disbelieve miracles.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: How desperately we wish to maintain our trust in those we love! In the face of everything  we try to find reasons to trust. Because losing faith is worse than falling out of love.
data.author: Sonia Johnson

data.quote: Faith is kind of like jumping out of an airplane at ten thousand feet. If God doesn't catch you  you splatter. But how do you know whether or not He is going to catch you unless you jump out?
data.author: Ann Kiemel

data.quote: Faith ... acts promptly and boldly on the occasion  on slender evidence.
data.author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

data.quote: The will of God will not take you where the grace of God cannot keep you.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Without risk  faith is an impossibility.
data.author: Soren Kierkegaard

data.quote: If it wasn't for faith  there would be no living in this world  we couldn't even eat hash with any safety.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: Living is a form of not being sure  not knowing what next  or how. The moment you know how  you begin to die a little. The artist never entirely knows. We guess. We may be wrong  but we take leap after leap in the dark.
data.author: Agnes de Mille

data.quote: Let us move on  and step out boldly  though it be into the night  and we can scarcely see the way. A Higher Intelligence than the mortal sees the road before us.
data.author: Charles B. Newcomb

data.quote: Faith is an assent of the mind and a consent of the heart  consisting mainly of belief and trust.
data.author: E. T. Hiscox

data.quote: The relation of faith between subject and object is unique in every case. Hundreds may believe  but each has to believe by himself.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: Whether we name divine presence synchronicity  serendipity  or graced moment matters little. What matters is the reality that our hearts have been understood. Nothing is as real as a healthy dose of magic which restores our spirits.
data.author: Nancy Long

data.quote: Maybe the tragedy of the human race was that we had forgotten that we are each divine.
data.author: Shirley MacLaine

data.quote: We cannot hand our faith to one another. ... Even in the Middle Ages  when faith was theoretically uniform  it was always practically individual.
data.author: John Jay Chapman

data.quote: Every human being is born without faith. Faith comes only through the process of making decisions to change before we can be sure it's the right move.
data.author: Dr. Robert H. Schuller

data.quote: I believe devoutly in the Word. The Word can save all  destroy all  stop the inevitable  and express the inexpressible.
data.author: Nina Voronel

data.quote: To believe in God is to yearn for His existence  and furthermore  it is to act as if He did exist.
data.author: Miguel de Unamuno

data.quote: The principle part of faith is patience.
data.author: George Macdonald

data.quote: I've been readen th Bible an a hunten God fer a long while-off an on- but it ain't so easy as picken up a nickel off the floor.
data.author: Harriette Arnow

data.quote: In prayer one must hold fast and never let go  because the one who gives up loses all. If it seems that no one is listening to you  then cry out even louder. If you are driven out of one door  go back in by the other.
data.author: Jane Frances de Chantal

data.quote: Faith is not belief. Belief is passive. Faith is active.
data.author: Edith Hamilton

data.quote: Can a faith that does nothing be called sincere?
data.author: Jean Racine

data.quote: Faith without works is dead.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: He does not believe who does not live according to his belief.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: I pray hard  work hard  and leave the rest to God.
data.author: Florence Griffith Joyner

data.quote: All effort is in the last analysis sustained by faith that it is worth making.
data.author: Ordway Tweed

data.quote: It is for us to pray not for tasks equal to our powers  but for powers equal to our tasks  to go forward with a great desire forever beating at the door of our hearts as we travel towards our distant goal.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: I have fought a good fight  I have finished my course  I have kept the faith.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Faith is not something to grasp  it is a state to grow into.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: Possessing faith is not convenient. You still have to live it.
data.author: Francoise Mallet-Joris

data.quote: Faith is a curious thing  It must be renewed  it has its own spring.
data.author: Gladys Taber

data.quote: However much we do to avoid them  we shall never lack crosses in this life if we are in the ranks of the Crucified.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: To disbelieve is easy  to scoff is simple  to have faith is harder.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: No faith is our own that we have not arduously won.
data.author: Havelock Ellis

data.quote: Faith is a living and unshakable confidence  a belief in the grace of God so assured that a man would die a thousand deaths for its sake.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: It is only mercenaries who expect to be paid by the day.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: Spirit is the real and eternal  matter is the unreal and the temporal.
data.author: Mary Baker Eddy

data.quote: Faith  to my mind  is a stiffening process  a sort of mental starch.
data.author: E. M. Forster

data.quote: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.
data.author: William Ellery Channing

data.quote: Faith is hidden household capital.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Faith is the soul riding at anchor.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: Faith is ... knowing with your heart.
data.author: N. Richard Nash

data.quote: Faith is an attitude of the person. It means you are prepared to stake yourself on something being so.
data.author: Arthur M. Ramsey

data.quote: Faith  as an intellectual state  is self-reliance.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Faith is the subtle chain which binds us to the infinite.
data.author: Elizabeth O. Smith

data.quote: Faith is nothing but obedience and piety.
data.author: Baruch Spinoza

data.quote: Faith is a theological virtue that inclines the mind  under the influence of the will and grace  to yield firm assent to revealed truths  because of the authority of God.
data.author: Adolphe Tanqueray

data.quote: Faith is the only known cure for fear.
data.author: Lena K. Sadler

data.quote: What's up is faith  what's down is heresy.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Faith is spiritualized imagination.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Faith is the final triumph over incongruity  the final assertion of the meaningfulness of existence.
data.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

data.quote: Faith is an encounter in which God takes and keeps the initiative.
data.author: Eugene Joly

data.quote: Faith is that which is woven of conviction and set with the sharp mordant of experience.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: Faith is a practical attitude of the will.
data.author: John MacMurray

data.quote: Faith is a total attitude of the self.
data.author: John Macquarrie

data.quote: Faith is nothing else than trust in the divine mercy promised in Christ.
data.author: Philipp Melanchthon

data.quote: Faith is the divine evidence whereby the spiritual man discerneth God  and the things of God.
data.author: John Wesley

data.quote: Faith is a passionate intuition.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Faith is a bridge across the gulf of death.
data.author: Edward Young

data.quote: Faith is verification by the heart  confession by the tongue  action by the limbs.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Faith is a certitude without proofs ... a sentiment  for it is a hope  it is an instinct  for it precedes all outward instruction.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Faith is the proper name of religious experience.
data.author: John Baillie

data.quote: Faith is the soul's adventure.
data.author: William Bridges

data.quote: Faith is obedience  nothing else.
data.author: Emil Brunner

data.quote: Faith is the response of our spirits to beckonings of the eternal.
data.author: George A. Buttrick

data.quote: Faith is a knowledge of the benevolence of God toward us  and a certain persuasion of His veracity.
data.author: John Calvin

data.quote: Faith is loyalty to some inspired teacher  some spiritual hero.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Faith is God's work within us.
data.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

data.quote: To me  faith means not worrying.
data.author: John Dewey

data.quote: Faith is building on what you know is here  so you can reach what you know is there.
data.author: Cullen Hightower

data.quote: Faith is a gift of God which man can neither give nor take away by promise of rewards  or menaces of torture.
data.author: Thomas Hobbes

data.quote: Faith is primarily a process of identification  the process by which the individual ceases to be himself and becomes part of something eternal.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Faith is the function of the heart.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: Faith implies the disbelief of a lesser fact in favor of a greater.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: The great act of faith is when a man decides that he is not God.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Faith is the little night-light that burns in a sick-room  as long as it is there  the obscurity is not complete  we turn towards it and await the daylight.
data.author: Abbe Henri Huvelin

data.quote: Faith is the summit of the Torah.
data.author: Solomon ibn Gabirol

data.quote: Faith is an act of self-consecration  in which the will  the intellect  and the affections all have their place.
data.author: William Ralph Inge

data.quote: Faith is courage  it is creative  while despair is always destructive.
data.author: David S. Muzzey

data.quote: Faith is to believe in something not yet proved and to underwrite it with our lives: it is the only way we can leave the future open.
data.author: Lillian Smith

data.quote: Faith begins as an experiment and ends as an experience.
data.author: William Ralph Inge

data.quote: Faith is an act of a finite being who is grasped by  and turned to  the infinite.
data.author: Paul Tillich

data.quote: Faith is not a storm cellar to which men and women can flee for refuge from the storms of life. It is  instead  an inner force that gives them the strength to face those storms and their consequences with serenity of spirit.
data.author: Sam J. Ervin

data.quote: Faith is putting all your eggs in God's basket  then counting your blessings before they hatch.
data.author: Ramona C. Carroll

data.quote: Faith is the force of life.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: Faith is a kind of betting  or speculation.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Without faith  nothing is possible. With it  nothing is impossible.
data.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

data.quote: Not truth  but faith it is that keeps the world alive.
data.author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

data.quote: Truth is simply whatever you can bring yourself to believe.
data.author: Alice Childress

data.quote: You can do very little with faith  but you can do nothing without it.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: I believe in the immortality of the soul because I have within me immortal longings.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The opposite of having faith is having self-pity.
data.author: Og Guinness

data.quote: Out of the chill and the shadow  Into the thrill and the shine  Out of the dearth and the famine  Into the fullness divine.
data.author: Margaret Elizabeth Sangster

data.quote: Faith is necessary to victory.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Faith is that quality or power by which the things desired become the things possessed.
data.author: Kathryn Kuhlman

data.quote: Every tomorrow has two handles. We can take hold of it by the handle of anxiety  or by the handle of faith.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Father! Blessed word.
data.author: Maria S. Cummins

data.quote: Faith assuages  guides  restores.
data.author: Arthur Rimbaud

data.quote: Far graver is it to corrupt the faith that is the life of the soul than to counterfeit the money that sustains temporal life.
data.author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

data.quote: I would rather live in a world where my life is surrounded by mystery than live in a world so small that my mind could comprehend it.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: We do not believe until we want a thing and feel that we shall die if it is not granted to us  and then we kneel and believe.
data.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

data.quote: Writing a novel without being asked seems a bit like having a baby when you have nowhere to live.
data.author: Lucy Ellman

data.quote: I am living on hope and faith ... a pretty good diet when the mind will receive them.
data.author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

data.quote: Faith is the sturdiest  the most manly of the virtues. It lies behind our pluckiest... strivings. It is the virtue of the storm  just as happiness is the virtue of the sunshine.
data.author: Ruth Benedict

data.quote: There is one inevitable criterion of judgment touching religious faith ... Can you reduce it to practice? If not  have none of it.
data.author: Hosea Ballou

data.quote: Strike from mankind the principle of faith  and men would have no more history than a flock of sheep.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: Be thou faithful unto death.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Faith is one of the forces by which men live  the total absence of it means collapse.
data.author: William James

data.quote: Pity the human being who is not able to connect faith within himself with the infinite.... He who has faith has ... an inward reservoir of courage  hope  confidence  calmness  and assuring trust that all will come out well-even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Faith is a gift of God.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: Through the dark and stormy night Faith beholds a feeble light Up the blackness streaking  Knowing God's own time is best  In a patient hope I rest For the full day-breaking!
data.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

data.quote: To win true peace  a man needs to feel himself directed  pardoned and sustained by a supreme power  to feel himself in the right road  at the point where God would have him be-in order with God and the universe. This faith gives strength and calm.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: Faith may be relied upon to produce sustained action and  more rarely  sustained contemplation.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: The person who has a firm trust in the Supreme Being is powerful in his power  wise by his wisdom  happy by his happiness.
data.author: Joseph Addison

data.quote: The disease with which the human mind now labors is want of faith.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: As your faith is strengthened you will find that there is no longer the need to have a sense of control  that things will flow as they will  and that you will flow with them  to your great delight and benefit.
data.author: Emmanuel

data.quote: The historic glory of America lies in the fact that it is the one nation that was founded like a church. That is  it was founded on a faith that was not merely summed up after it had exited  but was defined before it existed.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: The only faith that wears well and holds its color in all weather is that which is woven of conviction.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: The primary cause of unhappiness in the world today is ... lack of faith.
data.author: Carl Jung

data.quote: You do build in darkness if you have faith. When the light returns you have made of yourself a fortress which is impregnable to certain kinds of trouble  you may even find yourself needed and sought by others as a beacon in their dark.
data.author: Olga Rosmanith

data.quote: It is by faith that poetry  as well as devotion  soars above this dull earth  that imagination breaks through its clouds  breathes a purer air  and lives in a softer light.
data.author: Henry Giles

data.quote: Religious faith  indeed  relates to that which is above us  but it must arise from that which is within us.
data.author: Josiah Royce

data.quote: Faith enables persons to be persons because it lets God be God.
data.author: Carter Lindberg

data.quote: Faith makes the discords of the present the harmonies of the future.
data.author: Robert Collyer

data.quote: A person consists of his faith. Whatever is his faith  even so is he.
data.author: Hindu proverb

data.quote: In Israel  in order to be a realist  you must believe in miracles.
data.author: David Ben-Gurion

data.quote: For the believer  there is no question  for the non-believer  there is no answer.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Life without faith in something is too narrow a space in which to live.
data.author: George Lancaster Spalding

data.quote: Something will turn up.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Love means to commit oneself without guarantee  to give oneself completely in the hope that our love will produce love in the loved person. Love is an act of faith  and whoever is of little faith is also of little love.
data.author: Erich Fromm

data.quote: Above all things have devoted love among yourselves  for love covers a multitude of sins.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Love one another and you will be happy. It's as simple and as difficult as that.
data.author: Michael Leunig

data.quote: Because God is love  the most important lesson He wants you to learn on earth is how to love.
data.author: Rick Warren

data.quote: Love is not blind - it sees more  not less. But because it sees more  it is willing to see less.
data.author: Julius Gordon

data.quote: Since love grows within you  so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
data.author: St. Augustine

data.quote: If you judge people  you have no time to love them.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: The mystery of love is greater than the mystery of death.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Hatred paralyzes life  love releases it. Hatred confuses life  love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life  love illumines it.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent  conquer him with love.
data.author: Mahatma Gandhi

data.quote: Time is too slow for those who wait  too swift for those who fear  too long for those who grieve  too short for those who rejoice  but for those who love  time is eternity.
data.author: Henry Van Dyke

data.quote: Nobody has ever measured  not even poets  how much the heart can hold.
data.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

data.quote: Tell me who admires and loves you  and I will tell you who you are.
data.author: Charles-Augustin Sainte-Beuve

data.quote: I have been astonished that men could die martyrs for their religion I have shudder'd at it. I shudder no more. I could be martyr'd for my religion Love is my religion And I could die for that. I could die for you.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: Bitterness imprisons life  love releases it. Bitterness paralyzes life  love empowers it. Bitterness sours life  love sweetens it. Bitterness sickens life  love heals it. Bitterness blinds life  love anoints its eyes.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: No cord nor cable can so forcibly draw  or hold so fast  as love can do with a twined thread.
data.author: Robert Burton

data.quote: I believe that life is given us so that we may grow in love  and I believe that God is in me as the sun is in the color and fragrance of a flower.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: There is only one path to Heaven. On Earth  we call it Love.
data.author: Karen Goldman

data.quote: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your gold and good health have vanished.
data.author: Og Mandino

data.quote: Give all to love  obey thy heart.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Tis the most tender part of love  each other to forgive.
data.author: John Sheffield

data.quote: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love  prayer and forgiveness.
data.author: H. Jackson Brown

data.quote: Love blinds us to faults  hatred to virtues.
data.author: Moses Ibn Ezra

data.quote: Agape is disinterested love. . . . Agape does not begin by discriminating between worthy and unworthy people  or any qualities people possess. It begins by loving others for their sakes. . . . Therefore  agape makes no distinction between friend and enemy  it is directed toward both.
data.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

data.quote: Do not waste time bothering whether you "love" your neighbor  act as if you did. As soon as we do this we find one of the great secrets. When you are behaving as if you loved someone  you will presently come to love him. If you injure someone you dislike  you will find yourself disliking him more. If you do him a good turn  you will find yourself disliking him less.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: We are obliged to love one another. We are not strictly bound to "like" one another.
data.author: Thomas Merton

data.quote: To love one's neighbors  to love one's enemies  to love everything - to love God in all His manifestations - human love serves to love those dear to us but to love one's enemies we need divine love.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: Love is what we were borne with. Fear is what we learned here.
data.author: Marianne Williamson

data.quote: The higher animals are in a sense drawn into Man when he loves them and makes them (as he does) much more nearly human than they would otherwise be.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light  and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Beloved  let us love one another: for love is of God  and every one that loveth is born of God  and knoweth God.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: We're born alone  we live alone  we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
data.author: Orson Welles

data.quote: Love and work are the cornerstones of our humanness.
data.author: Sigmund Freud

data.quote: That best portion of a good man's life  His little  nameless  unremembered acts Of kindness and of love.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever  Its loveliness increases  it will never Pass into nothingness.
data.author: John Keats

data.quote: God loves us the way we are  but too much to leave us that way.
data.author: Leighton Ford

data.quote: Though our feelings come and go  God's love for us does not.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times  and within reach of every hand.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: All wise people say the same thing  that you are deserving of love  and that it's all here now  everything you need. When you pray  you are not starting the conversation from scratch  just remembering to plug back into a conversation that's always in progress.
data.author: Anne Lamott

data.quote: Speak to me of love  said St Francis to the almond tree  and the tree blossomed.
data.author: Nicholas Kazantzakis

data.quote: Faith is the continuation of reason.
data.author: William Adams

data.quote: Faith is to believe what we do not see  and the reward of this faith is to see what we believe.
data.author: St. Augustine

data.quote: An outward and visible sign of an inward and spiritual grace.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: AH I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Faith is the substance of things hoped for  the evidence of things not seen.
data.author: Hebrews

data.quote: Let us have faith that right makes might  and in that faith  let us  to the end  dare to do our duty as we understand it.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Here I stand. I can do no otherwise. God help me. Amen.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: There lives more faith in honest doubt  Believe me  than in half the creeds.
data.author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

data.quote: I have fought a good fight  I have finished my course  I have kept the faith.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Faith is the force of life.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: I can believe anything  provided it is incredible.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: There is no such thing as white lies  a lie is as black as a coalpit  and twice as foul.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Round numbers are always false.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: False in one thing  false in everything
data.author: Law Maxim

data.quote: Falsehoods not only disagree with truths  but usually quarrel among themselves.
data.author: Daniel Webster

data.quote: Adlai Stevenson - a Henry James character in a Reader's Digest world.
data.author: Cleveland Amory

data.quote: Glory is fleeting  but obscurity is forever.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: Have regard for your name  since it will remain for you longer than a great store of gold.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: I have touch'd the highest point of all my greatness  And from that full meridian of my glory I haste now to my setting.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Men are much more unwilling to have their weaknesses and their imperfections known than their crimes.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: One of the drawbacks of Fame is that one can never escape from it.
data.author: Nellie Melba

data.quote: Popularity is a crime from the moment it is sought  it is only a virtue where men have it whether they will or not.
data.author: Sir George Savile

data.quote: That sovereign of insufferables.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: The only man who wasn't spoilt by being lionized was Daniel.
data.author: Herbert Beerbohm Tree

data.quote: The ordinary man casts a shadow in a way we do not quite understand. The man of genius casts light.
data.author: George Steiner

data.quote: Though familiarity may not breed contempt  it takes off the edge of admiration.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: When I pass my name in such large letters I blush  but at the same time instinctively raise my hat.
data.author: Herbert Beerbohm Tree

data.quote: Fame is the sum of the misunderstanding that gathers about a new name.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: Now when I bore people at a party  they think it's their fault.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: One must choose between Obscurity with Efficiency  and Fame with its inevitable collateral of Bluff.
data.author: William McFee

data.quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
data.author: Antonio Porchia

data.quote: After I am dead  I would rather have men ask why Cato has no monument than why he had one.
data.author: Cato the Elder

data.quote: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking about something else.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: The greatest monarch on the proudest throne is obliged to sit upon his own arse.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: All celebrated people lose dignity on a close view.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: A celebrity is a person known for his well-knownness. Celebrities intensify their celebrity images simply by being well known for relations among themselves. By a kind of symbiosis  celebrities live off each other.
data.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

data.quote: Before such a prodigious career  judgement is torn between blame and admiration.
data.author: Charles de Gaulle

data.quote: Famous remarks are very seldom quoted correctly.
data.author: Simeon Strunsky

data.quote: It is strange how the memory of a man may float to posterity on what he would have himself regarded as the most trifling of his works.
data.author: William Osier

data.quote: To be somebody you must last.
data.author: Ruth Gordon

data.quote: The world  like an accomplished hostess  pays most attention to those whom it will soonest forget.
data.author: John Churton Collins

data.quote: Public opinion: a vulgar  impertinent  anonymous tyrant who deliberately makes life unpleasant for any one of us who is not content to be the average man.
data.author: Dean William R. Inge

data.quote: Man's attitude toward great qualities in others is often the same as toward high mountains - he admires them but he prefers to walk around them.
data.author: Moritz Saphir

data.quote: All the fame I look for in life is to have lived it quietly.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: A celebrity is one who is known to many persons he is glad he doesn't know.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Fame is a bee It has a song - It has a sting - Ah  too  it has a wing.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: A sign of a celebrity is often that his name is worth more than his services.
data.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

data.quote: Martyrdom is the only way a man can become famous without ability.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: He that hath the name to be an early riser may sleep till noon.
data.author: James Howell

data.quote: Some day each of us will be famous for fifteen minutes.
data.author: Andy Warhol

data.quote: I awoke one morning and found myself famous.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: To many fame comes too late.
data.author: Luis de Camoens

data.quote: If you would not be forgotten as soon as you are dead  either write things worth reading or do things worth writing.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Men think highly of those who rise rapidly in the world  whereas nothing rises quicker than dust  straw  and feathers.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Fame is the perfume of heroic deeds.
data.author: Socrates

data.quote: Fame is but the breath of the people  and that often unwholesome.
data.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

data.quote: No true and permanent Fame can be founded except in labors which promote the happiness of mankind.
data.author: Charles Sumner

data.quote: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: In fame's temple there is always a niche to be found for rich dunces  importunate scoundrels  or successful butchers of the human race.
data.author: Zimmermann

data.quote: Familiarity breeds contempt.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Though familiarity may not breed contempt  it takes off the edge of admiration.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: The living together for three long  rainy days in the country has done more to dispel love than all the perfidies in love that have ever been committed.
data.author: Arthur Helps

data.quote: He who has daughters is always a shepherd.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: I am married to Beatrice Salkeld  a painter. We have no children  except me.
data.author: Brendan Behan

data.quote: I don't know who my grandfather was  I am much more concerned to know what his grandson will be.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: I have called the principle  by which each slight variation  if useful  is preserved by the term of Natural Selection.
data.author: Charles Darwin

data.quote: Mothers can get weaned as well as babies.
data.author: Thomas Chandler Haliburton

data.quote: There are no illegitimate children - only illegitimate parents.
data.author: Leon R. Yankwich

data.quote: All happy families resemble one another  every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
data.author: Leo Tolstoy

data.quote: The dark  uneasy world of family life - where the greatest can fail and the humblest succeed.
data.author: Randall Jarrell

data.quote: As a general thing  when a woman wears the pants in a family  she has a good right to them.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: I am he As you are me And we are all together.
data.author: John Lennon

data.quote: Of all my wife's relations I like myself the best.
data.author: Joe Cook

data.quote: There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
data.author: Jane Austen

data.quote: When family relations are no longer harmonious  we have filial children and devoted parents.
data.author: R. D. Laing

data.quote: The family is the American fascism.
data.author: Paul Goodman

data.quote: The thing that impresses me most about North America is the way parents obey their children.
data.author: Edward, Duke of Windsor

data.quote: Who of us is mature enough for offspring before the offspring themselves arrive? The value of marriage is not that adults produce children but that children produce adults.
data.author: Peter de Vries

data.quote: Absence is one of the most useful ingredients of family life  and to do it rightly is an art like any other.
data.author: Freya Stark

data.quote: No matter how many communes anybody invents  the family always creeps back.
data.author: Margaret Mead

data.quote: There are fathers who do not love their children  there is no grandfather who does not adore his grandson.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
data.author: Theodore Hesburgh

data.quote: Today  while the titular head of the family may still be the father  everyone knows that he is little more than chairman  at most  of the entertainment committee.
data.author: Ashley Montagu

data.quote: A mother's love for her child is like nothing else in the world. It knows no aw  no pity  it dares all things and crushes down remorselessly all that stands in its path.
data.author: Agatha Christie

data.quote: Mother love has been much maligned. An over mothered boy may go through life expecting each new woman to love him the way his mother did. Her love may make any other love seem inadequate. But an unloved boy would be even more likely to idealize love. I don't think it's possible for a mother or father to love a child too much.
data.author: Frank Pittman

data.quote: Unconditional love is loving your kids for who they are  not for what they do ... it isn't something you will achieve every minute of every day. But it is the thought we must hold in our hearts every day.
data.author: Stephanie Marston

data.quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Where does the family start? It starts with a young man falling in love with a girl - no superior alternative has yet been found.
data.author: Winston Churchill

data.quote: Of course if you like your kids  if you love them from the moment they begin  you yourself begin all over again  in them and with them.
data.author: William Saroyan

data.quote: You can see them alongside the shuffleboard courts in Florida or on the porches of the old folks' homes up north.... They are in love  they have always been in love  although sometimes they would have denied it. And because they have been in love they have survived everything that life could throw at them  even their own failures.
data.author: Ernest Havemann

data.quote: In family life  love is the oil that eases friction  the cement that binds closer together  and the music that brings harmony.
data.author: Eva Burrows

data.quote: Family love is messy  clinging  and of an annoying and repetitive pattern  like bad wallpaper.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: In truth a family is what you make it. It is made strong  not by number of heads counted at the dinner table  but by the rituals you help family members create  by the memories you share  by the commitment of time  caring  and love you show to one another  and by the hopes for the future you have as individuals and as a unit.
data.author: Marge Kennedy

data.quote: [A mother] discovers with great delight that one does not love one's children just because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.
data.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

data.quote: The Family is the Country of the heart. There is an angel in the Family who  by the mysterious influence of grace  of sweetness  and of love  renders the fulfillment of duties less wearisome  sorrows less bitter. The only pure joys unmixed with sadness.
data.author: Giuseppe Mazzini

data.quote: Smile at each other  smile at your wife  smile at your husband  smile at your children  smile at each other - it doesn't matter who it is and that will help you to grow up in greater love for each other.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: No man has ever lived that had enough of children's gratitude or woman's love.
data.author: William Butler Yeats

data.quote: I take my children everywhere  but they always find their way back home.
data.author: Robert Orben

data.quote: Happiness is having a large  loving  caring  close-knit family in another city.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: The real question isn't whether or not you love your kids  but how well you are able to demonstrate your love and caring so that your children really feel loved.
data.author: Stephanie Marston

data.quote: The last step in parental love involves the release of the beloved  the willing cutting of the cord that would otherwise keep the child in a state of emotional dependence.
data.author: Lewis Mumford

data.quote: So if you have a grandma  Thank the Good Lord up above  And give Grandmama hugs and kisses  For grandmothers are to love.
data.author: Lois Wyse

data.quote: Oh  I love to see a man with a cigar. It reminds me of my grandfather. Morning to night  he used to sit with a great big stogie dangling from his lips. Oh  the hours we kids used to spend sitting on his lap  playing with the yellow whiskers beneath his nose. Then he'd take out his teeth with the cigar still in them and chase us around the room! We'd all laugh and laugh . . . then suddenly Grampa's mood would change  and we'd all have to run for our lives. . . . You can't buy memories like that.
data.author: Daphne Frasier

data.quote: Children begin by loving their parents. After a time they judge them. Rarely  if ever  do they forgive them.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: It is my pleasure that my children are free and happy  and unrestrained by parental tyranny. Love is the chain whereby to bind a child to its parents.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Perfect love sometimes does not come until the first grandchild.
data.author: Welsh proverb

data.quote: The reason grandparents and grandchildren get along so well is that they have a common enemy.
data.author: Sam Levenson

data.quote: The whole world is my family.
data.author: Pope John XXIII

data.quote: To us  family means putting your arms around each other and being there.
data.author: Barbara Bush

data.quote: The happiest moments of my life have been the few which I have passed at home in the bosom of my family.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: The family with an old person in it possesses a jewel.
data.author: Chinese saying

data.quote: Babies are such a nice way to start people.
data.author: Don Herold

data.quote: Each time a new baby is born there is a possibility of reprieve. Each child is a new being  a potential prophet  a new spiritual prince  a new spark of light precipitated into the outer darkness.
data.author: R. D. Laing

data.quote: Bringing a child into the world is the greatest act of hope there is.
data.author: Louise Hart

data.quote: Children are the world's most valuable resource and its best hope for the future.
data.author: John F. Kennedy

data.quote: Blessed be childhood  which brings down something of heaven into the midst of our rough earthliness.
data.author: Henri Amiel

data.quote: Children are the bridge to heaven.
data.author: Persian proverb
